roleset.name: hit hard and repeatedly
roleset.note: POUND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'pound' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from pound.02-v predicate notes)

role.descr: instrument, thing hit by or with

example.name: very literal
example.text: ``I don't think most of the people that have been around me would ever say they've seen me pound the table or get angry.''

example.name: passivized
example.text: [The stock of UAL Corp.]-1 continued *trace*-1 to be pounded *trace*-1 amid signs that British Airways may balk at any hasty reformulation of the aborted $6.79 billion buy-out of United Airlines' parent.
example.arg: amid signs that British Airways may balk at any hasty reformulation of the aborted $6.79 billion buy-out of United Airlines' parent

example.name: violence
example.text: Mary pounded John with a wet noodle.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: His pounding the table at the U.N. was just another sign of his childish character and unwillingness to compromise.

example.name: heart, Arg0
example.text: Her heart's pounding nearly gave away her hiding place.

roleset.name: create a substance by pounding
roleset.note: POUND-V NOTES: This sense is very close to pound.02, and if the end product isunstated the two cannot be distinguished. Perhaps they should be merged? (from pound.03-v)

example.name: all args
example.text: Mary pounded John to a bloody pulp.

example.name: Arg0,1,2
example.text: Her pounding the spices into a delicious curry was legendary.

roleset.name: move quickly but heavily
roleset.note: POUND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'pound' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from pound.04-v predicate notes)

example.name: pounding the pavement
example.text: Watson pounded to the crawling man and stopped , [*-1] panting heavily .

roleset.name: pulsating outwardly
roleset.note: POUND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'pound' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from pound.05-v predicate notes)

example.name: Heart pounding
example.text: Her heart pounded against her chest.

example.name: Head pounding
example.text: After three tequilas, Marlene's head was pounding in pain.

roleset.name: extract, produce
roleset.note: POUND_OUT-V NOTES: Unlike other 'extract' verbs (classes 10.1, 10.2), 'pound out' does notseem to take a source argument. (from pound.01-v)

example.name: production
example.text: John can pound out 50 verb frames a week.
